title: L'viv food bank warehouse
description: 33 pallets of food arrived from Toidupank, FEBA (European Food Banks Federation) member in Estonia.
summary: Food providing at this location contain: canned fish and meat, meat, vegetables, powdered milk, soups, flour, oil, cereals, sugar, tea, yeast, and mature cheese.

title: Chernivsti food bank warehouse
description: 33 pallets of food arrived from Toidupank, FEBA (European Food Banks Federation) member in Estonia.
summary: Food providing at this location contain: canned fish and meat, meat, vegetables, powdered milk, soups, flour, oil, cereals, sugar, tea, yeast, and mature cheese.

title: Caritas Odesa UGCC food bank

summary: Caritas Odesa UGCC - Address: Lermontovs'kyi Ln, 13а, Odesa, Odessa Oblast, Ukraine, 65000

title: Chojnice food bank

summary: Call +52 39 50 571, +52 39 74 902, Open 08.00-16.00 or visit http://chojnice.bankizywnosci.pl/ for more information

title: Free emergency medical care
description: Free emergency medical care is available at Damiana Hospital
summary: Hours: Monday to Friday from 07:30 to 20:00 Saturday from 08.00 to 20.00 Sunday from 08.00 to 16.00

title: Free urgent medical care
description: Free medical care in urgent cases for people from Ukraine will also be provided by the network of medical cicadas.
summary: To arrange a consultation, you need to call (+48) 22 45 87 007 or write to e-mail.

title: Free psychological help hours
description: Lux Medical Free psychological help hours
summary: Telephone:+48 504 123 099: Hours: Tuesday from 12:00 to 14:00 Wednesday about 10: 00-13: 00 Thursday about 12: 00-14: 00 Friday from 12:00 to 14:00 Inpatient visits to a psychologist: Wednesday from 15:00 to 17:00 Thursday from 15:00 to 17:00 Friday from 15:00 to 17:00

title: Physician Consultation Hours
description: Physician Speicalist in internal Medicin
summary: Hours:Tuesday from 11:00 to 14:00 Wednesday from 13:00 to 14:00 Thursday from 13:00 to 14:00 Friday from 11:00 to 14:00

title: Epilepsy Infoline
description: Infoline for Epilepsy
summary: The infoline is available at: (+48) 503 924 756. You can also write to e-mail: ukr@fundacjaemergen.com.

title: Free Gynecological Care
description: Services for individuals who are pregnant or need help, obstetrician-gynecologist
summary: You need a document confirming the border crossing and legal stay in Poland from February 24, 2022 in connection with the armed conflict in Ukraine: a certificate of the Polish Border Guard or a stamp of the Polish Border Guard in the passport / other travel document.

description: Free covid testing kits outside of the airport premise

description: Free covid testing kits near the airport premise
location: Generała Wiktora Thommée 1a, 05-102 Nowy Dwór Mazowiecki, Poland

title: Public transport in warsaw
description: Public transport in Warsaw is free of charge for all citizens of Ukraine upon presentation of an identity card or passport.
summary: Citizens of Ukraine can travel free of charge from Poland to Germany on the following trains: WAWEL 37000/56, GEDANIA 57000/58, BEROLINUM 17000/248, NIGHTJET 456/60456.

title: Ukranian House / Our choice foundation
description: Information about places for overnight stays and the base of apartments in Warsaw
summary: Call +48 727 805 764, Open 9.00-21.00 or visit https://ukrainskidom.pl/ for more information

title: Legal aid
description: Association for Legal Intervention
summary: Registration: mon. - fri 15.00-16.00 at +48 880 145 372 (interwencja@interwencjaprawna.pl) or visit www.ukraina.interwencjaprawna.pl for more information

title: Free urgent emergency medical care
description: Urgent, emergency, free medical care for persons arriving from Ukraine, provided in all LUX MED institutions throughout Poland
summary: Call +48 22 45 87 007, open daily from 9.00 to 17.00, email: ua.kontakt@luxmed.pl or visit www.bit.ly/luxmed-UA

description: Polish government website page dedicated for Ukrainian citizens seeking refuge. It has a list of checkpoints and information in Ukrainian language.

description: An article providing information on how to evacuate from Ukraine

title: Cities to Seek Help Once in Poland
description: A list of cities to seek refuge to once evacuated from Ukraine
summary: Visit these cities once you have evacuated to Poland: Dorohusk, Dołhobyczów, Zosin, Hrebenne, Korczowa, Medyka, Budomierz, Krościenko

title: Legal Stay in Poland
description: How to legally stay in Poland after evacuating from Ukraine
summary: Citizens of Ukraine who left their homeland as a result of Russian aggression may legally stay for 18 months

title: Legal Aid for Refugees in Poland
description: Halina Nieć Legal Aid Center is providing legal aid to the following groups: asylum seekers / refugees, stateless persons, victims of human trafficking.
summary: For Urgent Matters, Contact: +48 693 390 502
